creditline: Lent by the Wang Xing Lou Collection
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: copper-red and blue floral pattern on white ground; neck wide at top and narrows at bottom; round body; two curved handles extend from top of neck to top of body; has storage box
marks: Inscription on bottom in blue: [(six character unt
medium: Porcelain with cobalt blue and copper-red decoration under clear glaze
text: This globular shaped flask is decorated in copper-red with a formal lotus scroll bearing twelve large blossoms and six smaller ones all symmetrically positioned within an overall tendril design executed in underglaze blue. Flasks of this type with strap-shaped handles were popular during the Yung-cheng (1723-35) and early Ch'ien-lung reigns (1736-95) when they were produced in a variety of glazes and decorative techniques.
title: Flask
